long: Meaning: "narrow"; (as a noun) a "tight" place (usually figuratively, i.e. "trouble"); also a "pebble" (as in "H6864"); (transitive) an "opponent" (as "crowding").  Usage: adversary, afflicted(-tion), anguish, close, distress, enemy, flint, foe, narrow, small, sorrow, strait, tribulation, trouble.  Source: or "צָר"; from "H6887";
